message: Hi Name,

After an active U.S. Supreme Court term, there is plenty to talk about! Join Illinois Law Dean and Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf as they participate in an exciting discussion of SCOTUS decisions (and lack of decisions) this term, moderated by Rutgers Law School Adjunct Professor David Kemp.
Presentation details are below:

Date: Wednesday, July 19, 2023
Time: 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT
Where: Virtually via Justia Connect
Duration: 60 Minutes

Name,

After a busy Independence Day, just a quick reminder that Supreme Court 2022-23 Term in Review is coming up in two short weeks! Join Justia Webinars for an exciting discussion with Illinois Law Dean and Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf reviewing the key cases decided in the recent Supreme Court Term, as well as some potentially surprising matters the court failed to address.

Time permitting, topics covered will include race-based affirmative action in higher education settings, judicial review of political gerrymandering, conflicts between free speech and anti-discrimination law, student loan debt forgiveness, state regulation of animal welfare, adoption preference for tribal members under the Indian Child Welfare Act, Title 42 border policy, social media company liability for third-party content, and more!
bottomline: Seats are going fast. Register to save yours today.

message: Name,

Just sending you this quick, post-holiday reminder that you are registered for our upcoming Justia Webinar: Supreme Court 2022-23 Term in Review. The presentation will begin promptly at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT on Wednesday, July 19.
On presentation day, you can come back to this email and use this link to join us. If you have trouble accessing this presentation, please contact Justia Support for assistance
We are already counting down to this exciting event and hope you are too! See you there in just two short weeks.

Supreme Court 2022-23 Term in Review presented by Justia Webinars is on Wednesday, July 19 at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT. Remember to mark your calendar so you do not miss this exciting event, led by Illinois Law Dean and Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf
Use this link to join us 10 minutes before presentation time.
If you have trouble accessing this webinar, please contact Justia Support for assistance.

Donâ€™t miss out on this exciting free opportunity to catch up on the latest from SCOTUS with Illinois Law Dean and Professor Vikram Amar and Cornell Law School Professor Michael Dorf in a discussion moderated by Rutgers Law School Adjunct Professor David Kemp.
bottomline:
Date: Wednesday, July 19, 2023

message3: Time permitting, topics covered will include race-based affirmative action in higher education settings, judicial review of political gerrymandering, conflicts between free speech and anti-discrimination law, student loan debt forgiveness, state regulation of animal welfare, adoption preference for tribal members under the Indian Child Welfare Act, Title 42 border policy, social media company liability for third-party content, and more! Plus, if time allows, Professors Amar and Dorf will discuss recent calls to impose a binding ethics code on U.S. Supreme Court justices.
